awd_titl_txt: Studying Efficiency and Generality in Parallel Computing    Using a Machine-Independent Programming Language
awd_abstract_narration: This is a project to extend, implement, and evaluate a special-purpose          programming language for computer vision.  The language, called Apply,          includes parallel constructs for local vision operators that are                compiled differently for different architectures.  The extension being          developed includes constructs for global control through divide-and-            conquer, and is intended to allow portable parallel programs that can           be ported between dissimilar architectures to be written.  A compiler           for extended Apply is available for each of several different parallel          architectures, and compiled code is being compared to handwritten code          on each architecture.  In addition, a widely used package of vision             routines is being rewritten in the extended language and distributed for        evaluation within several applications groups.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
